metadata.subject: The J.P. Morgan View: Local forces are dominating

relationships.description: Financial institution providing market analysis and investment recommendations to clients
Analyst/strategist at JPMorgan Chase Bank NA
Analyst/strategist at J.P. Morgan Securities plc

analysis.purpose: To provide J.P. Morgan's market analysis and investment recommendations to clients regarding global asset allocation and market trends
analysis.significance: Regular financial market commentary from a major investment bank during a period of European banking crisis (Cyprus) and global market uncertainty

notable_quotes: 'Risk-on, risk-off is so last year' - describing the shift from global market correlations to localized investment opportunities

'The imposition of capital controls on Cypriot deposits is to be sure a watershed moment, but for now not one we expect to spark significant deposit withdrawals elsewhere' - assessment of Cyprus banking crisis impact

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found - this is standard financial market analysis

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - this is legitimate financial market analysis and investment recommendations

public_knowledge.context: Regular financial market commentary that would have been distributed to J.P. Morgan clients and likely reflects widely available market analysis from March 2013

analysis.summary: J.P. Morgan's weekly market analysis email discussing how local forces rather than global themes are driving investment opportunities, with specific recommendations on equities (overweight Japan), fixed income, currencies, and commodities, while analyzing the impact of the Cyprus banking crisis on European markets.
